intro: Dicliptera iopus, commonly known as the narrowleaf panicgrass, is a perennial grass native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It typically grows in open woodlands and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. The plant has slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its inflorescence consists of a loose panicle made up of small, two-ranked spikelets. Dicliptera iopus is often used in restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and tolerate drought conditions.
